name: JW Marriott Hotel Los Angeles at L.A. LIVE

reviews.text: This hotel is very conveniently located to the Convention Center and L.A. Live restaurants. The staff members were friendly and helpful. I appreciated not having long lines at the elevators which often happens at convention hotels. The rooms were quite spacious, impeccably clean and comfortable. People who requested a late check-out were only given an additional hour but the staff handled the check out process efficiently for the large number of people attending the conference. After hearing others attending the conference describing their postage stamp sized room at a hotel much further from the Convention Center, I'm happy I paid a little more to stay at the Marriott.
reviews.title: Great for convention attendees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel was top notch. We stayed for an event at the LA Convention Center, and the location was perfect. There were lots of great restaurants and entertainment walking distance from the hotel. We used the valet, but I'd recommend against that if you don't absolutely need a car - the $40 per day adds up quickly.
reviews.title: Great location, 1st class hotel

reviews.text: The thing I liked best about this hotel was the staff - they were always helpful, very friendly, professional, and exactly who you'd expect at a Marriott!
reviews.title: Top notch hotel

reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience from the moment we pulled up to the hotel. The bellman was very nice and helpful as was the valet. The staff at the reception desk were very polite and service oriented. My request for a high floor was accommodated and the room was very clean with a city view. We hd access to a concierge lounge on the fourth floor which provided free food and beverages. I attended a conference while my family stayed behind. Unfortunately there is nothing to do for kids in the immediate area, but there are several restaurants. One day I needed something from my car, and the valet attendant took me in a golf cart to my car to retrieve the item. Each time I took my car out, the valet attendant got it very quickly. Joy at the concierge desk was wonderful and helped us book a tour the same day. The hotel was quiet. Each day housekeeping checked what time my family was leaving the room and returned to clean it later. It was really a wonderful sty and I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: 4 Nights at JWMarriott for Conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights at the JWMarriott in LA as I was tagging along w/hub. His conference was held at the Staples Center which is just a short walk from the JWM. The general vicinity of the JWM is very clean with much security. Lots of foot traffic & tourists. Hotel itself is beautiful & the rooms clean/spacious. Ours had a mini-fridge which was AWESOME b/c I almost had a coronary at the $25 chicken salad avail at the hotel! Walk 3 blocks over to Ralph's Grocery Store & stock up. Also, we had great view of JLive area, but our window/room was part of a lighted sign on the building. This means there are bars across the windows that block the view. If you care, make sure to ask for a room not a part of the sign. Workout room is awesome! Clean, spacious, lots of equipment, water, fruit, etc. Weather wasn't overly warm in Feb, but the pool area is so inviting. Super nice layout.
reviews.title: great location to Staples!

reviews.text: This hotel keeps getting better and if you havent experienced the JW Marriott LA Live you are missing out ! The lobby restaurants are amazing , delicious and beautiful. The decor is lively and the rooms spacious.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in LA

reviews.text: This JW is located in an excellent area within walking distance of restaurants and a movie theater. The hotel staff is knowledgeable and helpful and all seem to be happy with their job! The rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights while in town for a conference. It is a nice hotel - my room was spacious, comfy bed, good toiletries, robe. The shower had good water pressure, and the shower head was very high up. I imagine that taller hotel guests would really appreciate this. Also, the room had two complementary bottles of water that were replenished daily. The room decor was west- coast modern...some orange furniture mixed with some more classic pieces. I never ate at the hotel restaurants, so I can't comment on those. There is a Starbucks right outside the back doors of the lobby for anyone like me who really depends on their latte fix. It is about a 10 minute walk to the convention center if you are a relatively fast walker. The Staples Center is even closer, and there are many restaurants within a 5 minute walk or less.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near Convention Center

reviews.text: One thing I did not like: on checkin, I asked for a 1 hour delay in my checkout time and was refused. Really? You can't even extend by an hour? I thought that was a bit much. Other than that the service was great, especially housekeeping.
reviews.title: Doesn't get any better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel. Awesome location. Lounge at the pool, go to a movie, have a nice meal, and see a game at the Staples Center. Do it all in one day and never walk more than 5 minutes for any of it. If you can, plan your stay downtown in the LA Live section and do not pass up this hotel.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights at this hotel for a convention and overall not impressed; At >$300 a night and the flagship of the Marriott group I would have expected more. Check in was unorganized and took forever which is not fun after a long flight. Rooms are more like a Courtyard Marriott than a JW. Very simple rooms, no luxury and bathrooms are unimpressive. Service at the bar very slow and laid back. Food at the restaurant was just terrible- went there only because there arent many options in downtown LA. Checkout took forever to settle the bill which caused a delay to get back the airport. Would not recommend staying here as it is far from everything nice to do in LA.
reviews.title: Not very impressive..

reviews.text: For a convention hotel, the JW Marriott was very nice. It was close to the Convention Center and LA Live gives attendees lots of choices for food and beverage. The WiFi had very spotty service and was expensive. It was better to be hard-wired in the room if you were going to pay for the service. There were plenty of towels in the bathroom although some were quite worn out. They gym and spa were part of the Ritz Carlton located next door so they were very nice although the spa was quite expensive. The Executive Lounge is normally not open on the weekends which could have been a big issue but our meeting organizer arranged to have it open for our meeting. If you are a business traveler and getting reimbursed for your stay or attending an event at the Staples Center or Nokia Theater, this is a nice hotel. Otherwise, it is quite far from tourist destinations and there isn't much around the area to do in free time.
reviews.title: Convention Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in the LA LIVE area, so close to the Nokia Theatre (right beside) and the Staples Center (across the street). It's also a 5 minute walk to the Convention Center. Despite looking nice, the shower is horrible, and you need to get into the shower to turn it on = getting soaked with cold water!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: This was my first time in LA and I went with a couple of friends who were Marriott members. This is an awesome hotel next to the Staples Center. The building is practically brand new and is very nicely finished. The staff was friendly and the room was over-sized with good views of LA Live. I wished I stayed longer!
reviews.title: First Time in LA

reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the JW for a national convention. We were sad to find our room had leftover food in the mini fridge and dried up rose peddles behind the bathroom door (apparently someone had a nice night). Our tv did not work and they did send someone to fix it, but the next day it broke again. We are also not from the area and had not been to LA before. When we asked for directions to a shopping area they sent us 8 blocks in a very "shady" area where their were street vendors. Not quite my idea of a shopping area. We also were told to ride the Metro to get to Long Beach. Not a big deal to us, but it would have been nice to have been tipped off on how long it would take 1.5 hours and what areas we would be traveling through. I am just disappointed in the customer service of a JW. They never bothered to consider we may not be familiar to the area and never gave very good directions etc.
reviews.title: From Out of Town

reviews.text: Am staying at the Marriott LA live for a conference. Couldn't be more happy with this property. Location is fantastic and it's very easy to walk to many great restaurants and show venues. The rooms themselves are extremely spacious, very clean, and furnished in a contemporary style. Our room looks out onto the Hollywood sign in the city. Beautiful view. It has been kept superclean since the minute we walked into the hotel. There is no shortage of things to do in the area. It's also very easy to get in and out of my car and there are so many wonderful sites nearby that you can drive to that nobody will ever get bored here. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here even if I hadn't come to this area for a conference.
reviews.title: This Marriott has it all.

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is excellent. The rooms are spacious, modern and comfortable and the location is very good. Personally I felt the air was very dry in the hotel and the conference area.
reviews.title: Excellent Overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roof top pool is absolutely fantastic. It's the best part of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Check out my video of the rooftop pool:
reviews.title: Nice hotel- Great Downtown LA location

reviews.text: http://youtu.be/dNTdBYoMZ1Y
reviews.title: Reliable and comfortable hotel
